title: Green Beans with Pancetta and Onion
introduction: Green beans are more flavorful and have a better texture when cooked until tender. This dish combines the savory goodness of pancetta and the aromatic notes of onions and herbs, creating a delightful side that complements a variety of main courses. Originating from the Friuliâ€“Venezia Giulia region, this recipe ensures the green beans retain their firmness while being infused with rich flavors.
instructions: Snap off the stem ends of the green beans. Bring about 2 quarts of water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add the beans and salt to taste. Cook uncovered until the beans are crisp-tender, 4 to 5 minutes. Rinse the beans under cold water and drain well. Pat dry. Cut the beans into bite-size pieces.

In a large skillet, cook the pancetta, onion, garlic, parsley, and sage in the oil over medium heat until the onion is golden, about 10 minutes. Add the green beans and a pinch of salt. Cook until heated through, about 5 minutes more. Serve hot.
